pageContext.claim: “An estimated 17,000 ballots [in Michigan] were cast by dead people. Some dead people, by the way, also requested an application. It's true. Those are the ones that really bother me. They not only vote, but they request an application, that's a double.”
pageContext.analysis: "Trump's claim is false," reported The Detroit Free Press. "There is no evidence that dead people voted in Michigan's election. Michigan relies on Social Security Administration death records to flag deceased voters and maintain the integrity of voter files. In the November election, the state successfully identified ballots cast by 3,469 people who had passed away between casting their ballot and the election."
